input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">apachectl -k graceful-stop</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">apachectl -k graceful-stop</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description:
This process gracefully stops the Apache WebServer. The graceful-stop signal causes the parent process to advise the children to exit after their current request (or to exit immediately if they're not serving anything). The parent will then remove its PidFile and cease listening on all ports. The parent will continue to run, and monitor children which are handling requests. Once all children have finalised and exited or the timeout specified by the GracefulShutdownTimeout has been reached, the parent will also exit. If the timeout is reached, any remaining children will be sent the TERM signal to force them to exit.
If the apachectl program is not in the default path, please add the path to the command-dir of connection details.
